result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan A Gister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ethan A Gister is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ethan A Gister was found guilty of False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Ethan A Gister was found guilty of Attempt 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Ethan A Gister was found guilty of Attempt 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: Court will consider expunction on Ct 2 upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:Sex Offender assessment and any recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with the victim without permission of victim and agent, anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply w/ Sex Offender Registry.  15 Year Registry ordered.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Glinski. Clerk/H. Barnett. Statements from:  BSNM, Mindy N., Jaymie G. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 2, 3 & 4; deft to pay $750 DNA surcharge. No contact with victim without permission of victim and agent, anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent. Court will consider expunction on ct 2 upon successful completion of probation.
